title: Rust 1.41 stops recognizing pub const fns from a dep as const, regression from 1.40?

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Please find the minimum reproduction code below.

I have a crate using libpnet. Rust 1.40 compiled code just fine. Since I have upgraded Rust to 1.41, the crate no longer compiles. The compiler rejects the code with E0015.

Docs link to the libpnet pub const fn: https://docs.rs/pnet/0.25.0/pnet/packet/udp/struct.MutableUdpPacket.html#method.minimum_packet_size

The reproduction code compiles if the variable HDRLEN is not a const, such as:
```
    let HDRLEN: usize = MutableUdpPacket::minimum_packet_size();
```

I suspect it has something to do with how libpnet generates its structs and impls from macros. I cannot reproduce this regression with "hand-written" const fns such as: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=6a807abac8ec667038eb5d1e7b190329

Minimum reproduction:

main.rs:
```
use pnet::packet::udp::MutableUdpPacket;

fn main() {
    const HDRLEN: usize = MutableUdpPacket::minimum_packet_size();
    println!("{}", HDRLEN);
}
```

Dependencies in Cargo.toml
```
[dependencies]
pnet = { version = "^0.25" }
```
